title: World Bridges Quiz
description: Span the globe with this quiz about the world's most famous and impressive bridges, from ancient stone arches to modern marvels.

questions.question: The Golden Gate Bridge, painted in its signature 'International Orange,' spans the entrance to which bay?
Tower Bridge, often confused with London Bridge, features two towers connected by what type of walkways?
The Rialto Bridge, one of the oldest bridges crossing the Grand Canal, is located in which Italian city?
The Sydney Harbour Bridge, nicknamed 'The Coat Hanger,' is located in which country?
The Millau Viaduct, the tallest bridge in the world at 343 meters, is located in which country?
The Ponte Vecchio, a medieval stone bridge lined with shops, crosses the Arno River in which city?
The Brooklyn Bridge, completed in 1883, connects Manhattan to which New York City borough?
The Akashi Kaikyo Bridge in Japan holds the record as the world's longest what type of bridge?
The Chain Bridge (Széchenyi Lánchíd), a famous suspension bridge over the Danube, is in which city?
The Øresund Bridge connects Copenhagen, Denmark, to which Swedish city?
The Forth Bridge, a cantilever railway bridge and UNESCO World Heritage Site, is located in which country?
The Stari Most (Old Bridge) in Mostar, destroyed in 1993 and rebuilt in 2004, is in which country?
The Confederation Bridge, the longest bridge over ice-covered waters, connects Prince Edward Island to which Canadian province?
The Danyang-Kunshan Grand Bridge, the longest bridge in the world at about 164 km, is located in which country?
The Pont du Gard, an ancient Roman aqueduct bridge, is located in the south of which country?
